articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on Thursday said he was unaware of any intelligence suggesting Iran had moved any of its highly enriched uranium to shield it from U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear program over the weekend.
articles.title: No known intelligence that Iran moved uranium, US defense chief says

articles.author: Kantaro Komiya
articles.description: Japan executed a man on Friday who killed nine people after contacting them on social media, the first use of capital punishment in the country in nearly three years.
articles.title: Japan hangs 'Twitter killer' in first execution since 2022

articles.author: Maggie Michael
articles.description: "Don't wait for her," the WhatsApp caller told the family of Abeer Suleiman on May 21, hours after she vanished from the streets of the Syrian town of Safita. "She's not coming back."
articles.title: 'She's not coming back': Alawite women snatched from streets of Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh told his Chinese counterpart that the two countries should seek a "permanent solution" to their decades-old border dispute, India's defence ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: India seeks 'permanent solution' to border dispute with China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran would respond to any future U.S. attack by striking American military bases in the Middle East, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Thursday, in his first televised remarks since a ceasefire was reached between Iran and Israel.
articles.title: Supreme leader, in first appearance since ceasefire, says Iran would strike back if attacked

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and airstrikes killed at least 21 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Thursday, local health authorities said, as mediators reached out to Israel and Hamas to seek a resumption of ceasefire talks to end the war.
articles.title: Israeli attacks kill at least 21 people in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian drone attack on Russia's Kursk region on the border with Ukraine injured a war correspondent from the Chinese news outlet Phoenix TV, Russian authorities said late on Thursday, urging the United Nations to respond to the incident.
articles.title: Ukrainian drone attack on Kursk injures Chinese reporter, Russia says

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif held a call on Thursday in which they discussed promoting "a durable peace between Israel and Iran," the State Department said in a statement.
articles.title: US talks to Pakistan about promoting 'durable peace between Israel and Iran'

articles.author: Sandra Stojanovic
articles.description: Pastor Ara Torosian received a distressed phone call from two Iranian members of his Farsi-speaking church on Tuesday -- U.S. federal immigration officers were at their Los Angeles home to arrest them.
articles.title: Immigration officers arrest Iranian asylum-seekers in Los Angeles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Traffic on the Don River in the Kalachevsky district of Russia's Volgograd region was temporarily restricted to eliminate wreckage from a "massive" Ukrainian drone attack, the regional governor's administration said on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine's drone attack restricts traffic on Don River bridge in Russia's Volgograd
